intro: Hebenstretia oatesii subsp. inyangana, commonly known as the Inyangana hebenstretia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular, brightly colored blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
